data.title: Princes and Princesses (2000)
data.meta_description: In this episodic animated fantasy from France, an art teacher interprets a series of six fairy tales (each involving a prince or princess) with the help of two precocious students. Princes and Princesses was created using a special style of cutout animation, with black silhouetted characters performing the action against backlit backdrops in striking colors.

(dÃ©so cette review est une prise de note mdr)

My new favorite hobby is watching Michel Ocelot's animation without any subtitles. Princes and Princesses spins 6 fantasies about, brace yourself, princes and princesses across different cultures and times. The silhouette animation is gorgeous and conveys more than enough to clearly understand what's going on despite my not knowing any French. The highlight for me was wraparound setting of an art teacher and two students watching these tales in a theater one after the other and building on each previous one.

absolutely adored the animation, employing the use of fairy tales feels like an ode to the work of lotte reiniger but iâ€™m sure thatâ€™s an obvious comparison to make with silhouette animation.

as an anthology it was very lacklustre, though my favourites were definitely the third and final tales but any failings in the storytelling department are so easy to ignore when it all looks this incredible honestly.

This was really beautiful, I fell in love with the art style and stories. I wish there were more of these though. I cannot get enough!

The ending to this movie is so sweet, so romantic, and so unique that I can't put it into words. Has to be watched.
